text: I am trying to `vagrant up` and it is very slow... it seems that the problem is not with my connection
okay now it is OK
Hi All, this change-set of mine <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3323/> is failing because of sbft, do you know what's happening there? <@U0Y14MWA2>
Hi ... the next phase of tcerts is ready for review at <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3309/>  ... thanks
<@U0ZR63HLK> did you rebase recently ? I think there was a sbft fix yesterday or day before
<@U0ZR63HLK> i believe this one <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3305/>
got it
I will, thanks :slightly_smiling_face:
latest commit causes a crash in end to end test … opened JIRA to track <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-1415> …

<@U11MANG9G> <@U0PB67X4K> <@U0KN2SSKE> <@U1BC5A0F9> <@U0ZR63HLK> can we get <@U26T99AQ4>'s <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3293> reviewed and merged? the SDK are dependent on this to catch up to the latest fabric. the SDK has been broken for a while because of the ASN.1 based serialization that the SDK teams have been advocating to be removed, which this changeset replaces.
3293 looks good

Hi, I would like to point out that we are moving from a deterministic serialization mechanism (ASN.1), standard in crypto, to a non-deterministic serialization mechanism (protobuf), at least google does not guarantees deterministic serialization. This might cause problems later. It is better to have this in mind :slightly_smiling_face:
yeah - I had also offered just doing prefixing things with a byte to determine the type as well
BTW - we are serializing and signing protobufs in other areas as well  :wink:
I hope we are doing that having in mind this serialization issue
most of all serialization in `fabric/core` (I wish I can confidently say ALL) happens in `protos/utils`
good to  keep it that way … in general, all marshal/unmarshal under `protos` package where *.proto reside

<@U0ZR63HLK> yes Gari has brought this up as well before but at least as far as the proposal/transaction processing cycles are concerned this is not a problem, as the bytes are generated by the SDK and signed then they are verified as-is throughout the process without being unmarshalled and marshalled again which would have hit the non-deterministic serialization issue. as far as I’m aware, that’s all we need to care about
<@U13TWBRBL> <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3293> is merged

topic: This channel is mostly for comms between maintainers. If you want to draw our (and others!) to your/a CR/PR, please kindly use #fabric-pr-review.
text: <@U11MANG9G|jonathanlevi> set the channel topic: This channel is mostly for comms between maintainers. If you want to draw our (and others!) to your/a CR/PR, please kindly use #fabric-pr-review.
<@U0XQ35CDD> ^^^ (“what you said”)
<@U11MANG9G> thanks! and will start using the pr channel for these requests :wink:
BTW: It wasn’t intended just for you (I just happened to merged yours last)
no worries :wink:
It’s something that a few of the maintainers have been talking about, Kostas brought it up here yesterday, and I just go the chance of changing the “topic” of the channel….

Yeah, all is well. It’s fine to use this channel (e.g., regarding the serialization issue that was brought up here earlier, which is concerning! :-)), though the preference should be the *pr-review* one, indeed.
this one has quite a lot of comments which have been addressed  <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3241>  — can we merge?
let me push one reuse comment which is good to do
10 mins tops …

<@U0KN2SSKE|binhn> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/binhn/F3G4LJWSJ/pasted_image_at_2016_12_15_03_37_pm.png|Pasted image at 2016-12-15, 3:37 PM> and commented: on the lighter side
